This revenue is generated by the sale of products to customers, who are not involved in the manufacturing process. The lease is due to expire on May 29, 2025.

results.question: How is Basic earnings per share, or EPS calculated?
gold_answer: by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period, without consideration for common stock equivalents.
results.markdown_table_response:
Basic earnings per share, or EPS, is calculated by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period, without consideration for common stock equivalents. Diluted EPS is computed by dividing net income by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period and the weighted-average number of dilutive common stock equivalents outstanding for the period determined using the treasury-stock method.
For purposes of this calculation, common stock options, restricted stock units and restricted stock awards are considered to be common stock equivalents and are only included in the calculation of diluted EPS when their effect is dilutive. In periods in which the Company has a net loss, dilutive common stock equivalents are excluded from the calculation of diluted EPS.
The table below presents the computation of basic and diluted earnings per share:
For the years ended December 31, 2019, 2018 and 2017, the Company incurred net losses and accordingly excluded common stock equivalents for outstanding stockbased awards, which represented all potentially dilutive securities, of 2.5 million, 3.7 million, and 4.5 million, respectively, from the calculation of diluted net loss per share due to their anti-dilutive nature.
results.csv_string_response: Basic EPS is the net loss divided by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period. Diluted EPS is the net loss divided by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period and the weighted-average number of dilutive common stock equivalents outstanding for the period determined using the treasury-stock method.

The Company recognizes revenue in the period in which the services are provided, or performance obligations are satisfied, or the transaction price is allocated. Revenue is recognized when, or as, performance obligations under terms of a contract are satisfied, which occurs when control of the promised service is transferred to a customer. Revenue is measured as the amount of consideration the Company expects to receive in exchange for transferring services to a customer (“transaction price”). The Company will then recognize as revenue the amount of the transaction price that is allocated to the respective performance obligation when, or as, the performance obligation is satisfied. When determining the transaction price of the contract, an adjustment is made if payment from a customer occurs either significantly before or significantly after performance, resulting in a significant financing component. None of the Company’s licenses and collaboration agreements contained a significant financing component at either December 31, 2019 or 2018.

results.question: What led to lower capital expenditures at Bell Media in 2019?
gold_answer: production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018
results.markdown_table_response:
Capital expenditures for the year were down $17 million compared to 2018 due to:
• The deployment of our LTE-A network, which included both the acquisition of additional network access and a significant expansion of our LTE-A coverage in the Greater Toronto Area, which included the new community of Puntland
• The addition of fixed WTTP, which included the deployment of a fibre network to more homes and businesses, including the expansion of our fibre network to rural locations in Ontario and Québec
• The roll-out of fixed WTTP, which included the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts
results.csv_string_response: Based on the information provided in the table above, capital expenditures were reduced by $17 million, while capital intensity ratio was reduced by 0.3 pts. This is consistent with the expectations of the investment community, which suggests that we will continue to invest in our wireless and wireline segments. We are continuing to expand our network coverage, and we expect to see continued growth in subscriber and revenue. We are also executing our business customer contracts and are exploring opportunities to further extend our fixed and mobile networks.
results.json_rows_response: The lower capital expenditures at Bell Media in 2019 were primarily due to continued investment in our wireless segment and our transition to fixed wireless, as well as our continued investments in the roll-out of FTTP to more homes and businesses and the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts.

• Greater capital investments in our wireless segment of $33 million in 2019, compared to 2018, as we advanced the build-out of our LTE-A network, continued to deploy wireless small-cells to expand capacity to support subscriber growth and increase network speeds, coverage and signal quality, as well as to expand data fibre backhaul in preparation for 5G technology
• A modest reduction in capital spending in our wireline segment of $10 million in 2019, compared to last year, as we continued to focus our investments on the ongoing deployment of FTTP to more homes and businesses, the roll-out of fixed WTTP to rural locations in Ontario and Québec, the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts

results.question: How much did segment operating income change between 2017 and 2018?
results.markdown_table_response: Net Sales increased by $13.7 million or 10.8% in fiscal year 2018, as compared to $182.2 million in fiscal year 2017. This increase was primarily driven by an increase in net sales of $19.7 million, a $3.3 million increase in net sales in the distributor channel, a $4.2 million increase in the OEM channel, and a $4.0 million increase in the EMS channel.
results.csv_string_response: Segment operating income (loss) increased $12.7 million to $3.6 million from $9.0 million in fiscal year 2018. The increase was primarily attributable to an increase in net sales, as well as the benefit of completed restructuring activities.
results.json_rows_response: Segment operating income decreased $12.7 million from $9.0 million of operating loss in 2017. The decrease was primarily attributable to the benefit of the restructuring activities, including the $12.7 million increase in gross margin from $4.3 million in 2017. The decrease in operating income was partially offset by an increase in SG&A and R&D expenses of $2.1 million, a decrease in restructuring charges of $0.7 million, a decrease in SG&A of $0.6 million, and a decrease in R&D expenses of $0.6 million.
